questionTitle: He kept the door open by putting a ________ under it.
________ from Tom, all the workers said they would go.
This cloth ________ very thin.
He says he has got ________ in his stomach.
The taxi-drivers are complaining that their fares are too ________.
The gunman ________ the pilot of the plane to change direction.
As soon as the firebell rang everyone walked quickly downstairs and out of the building, ________ gathered in the car park.
He has a very strong ________ to see his country again.
Be careful! Don't ________ your drink on the table.
This wet weather has lasted for three weeks now; ________ rained every single day.
It is a very long ________ from Tokyo to London.
Excuse me! Can't you see the doctor's notice? Do you mind not ________?
Browns Ltd will have to ________ sales during the coming year.
The party, ________ I was the guest of honour, was extremely enjoyable.
That's the woman ________ daughter I nearly married when I was younger.
I would be thankful ________ any advice you can give me.
I haven't accused him ________ anything, but I suspect him of having taken it.
The spy surrendered himself ________ the enemy and was condemned to death.
Joyce's novel Finnegan's Wake continues to ________ critics, including those who find it comprehensible and call it ________.
Although this disease threatens the lives of several thousand persons every year, the ________ of supplies and equipment has ________ the progress of medical research for a cure.
